intro: Verbesina diversifolia subsp. macrantha, commonly known as the broadflower ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has palmately lobed leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a hardy addition to native gardens. Its showy inflorescences attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
